Name: Mallow Wood Long Table: "Engraved Memories"
Desc: A type of simple long table that can be seen in Petrichor cobbled together from pieces of leftover Mallow Wood. The sturdy tabletop is often used as a workstation by artisans or as a temporary storage rack. Rumor says that although such tables are very cheap to make, most users are loath to replace or change their workstation, as it is difficult to copy a working environment with which one is already familiar. And the crisscrossing grooves of knife and chisel pockmarking the surface are proof of the hard work they put in, day and night...
